intro: Brittonrosea hastata, commonly known as the narrowleaf Brittonrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Rosaceae family, which includes roses and other flowering shrubs. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open habitats such as hillsides and meadows. Brittonrosea hastata is often found in arid or semi-arid regions, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environmental conditions.
